text: Peter Backor (April 29, 1919 in Fort William, Ontario â€“ June 30, 1988) was a Canadian professional ice hockey defenceman. He played for the Toronto Maple Leafs in the NHL. ==Career== He played only one season in the NHL. Backor made it count as he helped the Toronto Maple Leafs win the Stanley Cup in 1945. After that season he spent the next 11 years playing in the minor leagues for the Pittsburgh Hornets of the AHL with whom he won the Calder Cup in 1952, the Hollywood Wolves of the PCHL and the Sault Ste. Marie Indians of the NOHL. Backor retired from hockey in 1956. He was one of the few players of Slovak descent in the NHL's younger years if not the first one ever. ==Personal life== He was brother-in-law to another NHL legend of Slovak descent Rudy Migay who played for Toronto Maple Leafs. ==Achievements== *AHL First All-Star Team (1946, 1948, 1949, 1950, 1951) *Stanley Cup Champions 1945 (with Toronto) ==Other websites== * * *Picture of Pete Backor's Name on the 1945 Stanley Cup Plaque *Pete Backor at Find-A-Grave Category:1919 births Category:1988 deaths Category:Canadian ice hockey defencemen Category:Ice hockey people from Ontario Category:Pittsburgh Hornets players Category:Sportspeople from Thunder Bay Category:Stanley Cup champions Category:Toronto Maple Leafs players
